cab.content: 3r3f j .^ It Secretary of State to Viceroy, Foreign Department, 5th July 1917.Foreign Secret. (Repeated to Sir P. Cox.)Your telegram dated 27thJune. . Clavton. HisMajesty's Government accept proposal made in Cox's telegram No. 2255,22nd June, viz., to appoint Storrs as Oriental Secretary to Chief PoliticalOfficer and to leave latter to make his own arrangements as hitherto inrespect of deputy, &c. Foreign Office- are asking Wingate to suggestsuitable terms of remuneration for Storrs.
